sense.def:
To wave
ali
to wave one's hand
pomeni premikati dlan po zraku z leve na desno, navadno v pozdrav ali slovo.

seg.quote: Jack gave his usual cheery wave.

sense.def:
To wave someone away
ali
to wave someone on
pomeni z dlanjo narediti gib, ki nekomu pove, kam naj gre.

To wave something
pomeni nekaj držati v zraku in hitro premikati z ene strani na drugo.

seg.quote: All along the route, people applauded and waved flags at them.

sense.def:
A wave
je narasla vodna gmota morja ali jezera, ki nastane zaradi vetra ali plimovanja.

seg.quote: ...the line of white foam where the waves broke on the beach.

sense.def:
Kadar imajo lasje
waves
, so valoviti.

Izraz
wave
uporabljamo za označevanje, kako nekaj potuje, na primer zvok, svetloba in radijski signal, ali kako se širi sila eksplozije ali potresa.

seg.quote: Radar employs radio waves whereas sonar uses sound waves.
...the shock wave from a one megaton bomb.

sense.def:
Izraz
wave
uporabljamo v izrazih, kot so
long wave
,
medium wave
in
short wave
, ki se nanašajo na nihanje ali frekvenco radijskih valov pri oddajanju.

A wave of sympathy, alarm, or panic
je vztrajno naraščanje naklonjenosti, strahu ali panike v skupini oseb ali posamezniku.

seg.quote: In the general wave of panic, nobody thought of phoning for an ambulance.

sense.def:
Izraz
wave
lahko uporabimo tudi za nenadno povečanje določene dejavnosti ali vrste vedênja.

seg.quote: In Paris in May 1968 there was a massive wave of student riots.
